title: Australian shares set to open higher as oil supply fears ease
text:
Australian shares set to open higher as oil supply fears ease

Stock Markets 1 hour ago (Sep 18, 2019 08:20)

© Reuters. Australian shares set to open higher as oil supply fears ease Sept 18 (Reuters) - Australian shares are likely to open a tad higher on Wednesday as Saudi Arabia restored oil supply after attacks on facilities over the weekend, although investors remain cautious ahead of the U.S. Federal Reserve's rate decision. The local share price index futures YAPcm1 rose 0.1%, a 7.7-point premium to the underlying S&P/ASX 200 index close. The benchmark rose 0.3% on Tuesday. New Zealand's benchmark S&P/NZX 50 index was flat in early trade.

Australian shares set to open higher as oil supply fears ease
description: Australian shares set to open higher as oil supply fears ease
